Thank you so much!

Yufan

Description:
Hi Casey,

 

I hope you are fine with this monthly placeholder 1:1 meeting on the first Wednesday of every month? 

 

In case the day or time-window is not okay for you, please let me know and I can change. Also if needed, we can always organize adhoc meetings. 

 

Thank you so much!

 

Best,

Yufan

Please note that this invite is only relevant for Statisticians working in Clinical Development

 

 



 

 

Meeting recurrence every 2 weeks

 

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session EU/US

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Please join us for an R-walk session. 

 

If you have suggestions for topics or want to share your experiences, please use this form <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/Future-topics-for-the-R-walks.aspx> . You can also find more information about anything R related on the R-portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/> . The agenda with upcoming topics, and all the past material of the R-walks can be found on the R-walk page <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx> . 

 

The same session is organized in US/EU and APAC/EU time zone in the same week. You are free to choose one of both sessions. 

 

If you have any questions please contact Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com> , Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

R-walk session EU/US

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Please join us for an R-walk session. 

 

If you have suggestions for topics or want to share your experiences, please use this form <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/Future-topics-for-the-R-walks.aspx> . You can also find more information about anything R related on the R-portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/> . The agenda with upcoming topics, and all the past material of the R-walks can be found on the R-walk page <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx> . 

 

The same session is organized in US/EU and APAC/EU time zone in the same week. You are free to choose one of both sessions. 

 

If you have any questions please contact Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com> , Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

 

Best regards,

IDAR C&SP

 

RPA Bot-Walk & Talk / Open Office Hours

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

As we transition from innovation to full adoption, we’d like to invite you to these Bot sessions. In these session, you will have opportunity to get focused trainings, hear from your coworkers about Bot experiences, get your questions answered and also provide feedback to improve Bots. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

Even though you will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions, please also log your questions through our BOT Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


We look forward to your participation. 

 

If you have any questions, please contact DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ <mailto:DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ%20%3cDL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ@its.jnj.com%3e> .

 

 

Best regards,

The C&SP RPA BOT Initiative Team

IDAR C&SP

 

RPA Bot-Walk & Talk / Open Office Hours

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

As we transition from innovation to full adoption, we’d like to invite you to these Bot sessions. In these session, you will have opportunity to get focused trainings, hear from your coworkers about Bot experiences, get your questions answered and also provide feedback to improve Bots. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

Even though you will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions, please also log your questions through our BOT Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


We look forward to your participation. 

 

If you have any questions, please contact DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ <mailto:DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ%20%3cDL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ@its.jnj.com%3e> .

 

 

Best regards,

The C&SP RPA BOT Initiative Team

Subject: [In-Person] Let's Have Fun After Meeting
Optional Attendees: Liu, Xiaochang [JRDCN];Chen, Yufan [JRDCN];Sun, Yuping [JRDCN];Li, Shechang [JRDCN];Cheng, Qianqian [JRDCN];Djali, Sina [JRDUS];Pan, Pan (Penn) [JRDCN];Zhang, Qianyuan (Shirley) [JRDCN];Hu, Peter Hao [JRDUS];Zhang, Ping [JRDCN];Cui, Dan [JRDCN];Chen, Kevin [JRDCN];Wei, Zhijie (Lyla) [JRDCN];Fan, David [JRDCN];Zhu, Qianqian (Debbie) [JRDCN];Liu, Tina [JRDCN];Ma, Qing (Gina) [JRDCN];Lyu, Lea You [JRDCN];Wu, Shuchun Coral [JRDCN];Wang, Jing [JRDCN];Wei, Chen [JRDCN];Peng, Mandy [JRDCN];Zhang, Ting [JRDCN];Zhu, Bochen [JRDCN];Zhang, Ying [JRDCN];Yang, Casey [JRDCN];Zhang, Xiaofeng [JRDCN];Liang, Juan [JRDCN];Pei, Yinghua [JRDCN]
Meeting Resources: CR-GC-CNShanghai, Bldg CHJ-A, Rm 4F-7 Global Connect (18)
Description:
Hi All,

          

We’ll utilize this timeslot to boost face-to-face connections with colleagues and LT. Do expect tons of fun games and activities, and you may have chance to win our surprise awards! 

 

Kindly note that this is an in-person-only ~15min event, and is not mandatory. But we would like to encourage employees to join the monthly meeting in office and take participate in this adjunctive activity, which is definitely a great opportunity to return to post-covid office, re-engage in our community, and re-connect with colleagues beyond projects. If you have any ideas or suggestions on how to advocate our in-person connection and collaboration, feel free to reach out to X-TA coordinators and Enliven team.

          

We hope everyone to relax, rejoice and have fun!

Description:
Please attend this session to learn about ‘What’s new in LSAF v5.4.1’.  If you are unable to attend, the presentation will be recorded and made available on the LSAF Portal-> Training Resources <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/LSAF/Pages/Training-Details.aspx> .

 

LSAF Production will be down starting Friday, July 14th through Monday, July 17th for the upgrade to LSAF v5.4.1.  

 

Additionally, look for meeting invites to the LSAF Open Office hours during the weeks after the LSAF upgrade to get any of your questions answered and issues reviewing by the DPS team.

 

With kind regards,

LSAF v5.4.1 Upgrade team

Description:
Please attend this session to learn about ‘What’s new in LSAF v5.4.1’.  If you are unable to attend, the presentation will be recorded and made available on the LSAF Portal-> Training Resources <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/LSAF/Pages/Training-Details.aspx> .

 

LSAF Production will be down starting Friday, July 14th through Monday, July 17th for the upgrade to LSAF v5.4.1.  

 

Additionally, look for meeting invites to the LSAF Open Office hours during the weeks after the LSAF upgrade to get any of your questions answered and issues reviewing by the DPS team.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            

With kind regards,

LSAF v5.4.1 Upgrade team

-----Original Appointment-----
From: Li, Shechang [JRDCN] 
Sent: 2023年6月20日 14:40
To: Li, Shechang [JRDCN]; Cheng, Changchun (Alex) [JRDCN]; Zhang, Xiaofeng [JRDCN]; Cheng, Gina [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Yu, Bin [JRDCN]; Ma, Qing (Gina) [JRDCN]; Cheng, Yu (Emily) [JRDCN]; Zhao, Yaxing [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Wu, Tingting [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Liu, Lihua [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Pei, Yinghua [JRDCN]; Chen, Yufan [JRDCN]; Du, Yingwen [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Fu, Guangjian [JRDCN]; Liu, Tingting [JRDCN NON-J&J]; Wang, Jing [JRDCN]; Hu, Peter Hao [JRDUS]; Yang, Casey [JRDCN]
Cc: Pan, Pan (Penn) [JRDCN]; Hou, Jieying [JRDCN]; Yao, Jianhui [JRDCN]; Li, Baoqing [JRDUS]; Song, Xiaolei (Lexy) [JRDCN]; Wei, Zhijie (Lyla) [JRDCN]; DL-JRDCN-SP-IMM; Wang, Zhuoyuan [JRDCN]; Guo, Yi [JRDCN]
Subject: NMPA eSub package preparation Workshop
When: 2023年7月5日星期三 10:00-12:00 (UTC+08:00) 北京，重庆，香港特别行政区，乌鲁木齐.
Where: Microsoft Teams Meeting

 

Dear all

            I hope this email finds you well. The new NMPA esub package preparation process has been in place for more than half a year. During this time, many colleagues from various TA teams have successfully prepared and delivered multiple packages using this new process.

To capitalize on the experience gained from these real projects and to gather feedback on the process, we are organizing our first NMPA eSub package workshop. We would like to invite all colleagues who have already completed this task or will be doing so in the coming year to attend.

During the workshop, the NMPA SME team will also provide updates on the tools and job aid related to this process.

Thank you for your attention, and we look forward to your participation. 

 

The meeting room reserved: Shanghai - One JNJ CHJ-A - 5F-1

            

Best regards

Shechang Li

Description:
Understanding Each Other: Know You, Know Me

 

A.R.I.S.E. Asia Regional Team is pleased to invite you to join our first forum “Understanding Each Other: Know You, Know Me…” This forum seeks to broaden global awareness regarding the linguistic diversity of Asia (China, India, and Japan) and the variations in time zones across the continent.

 

We will navigate through the intricacies of the languages and the cultural tapestry; dispelling common misconceptions, addressing the facts, myths, and perceptions, and providing a deeper understanding of the cultural significance.

 

Together, let’s continue to foster inclusivity by learning about our colleagues and cultures, thereby understanding each other. Please watch this brief preview video <https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/cfa671e7-8d8b-4d27-b5d2-8002c0c93a30>  (no audio) to learn more.

 

 <https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/cfa671e7-8d8b-4d27-b5d2-8002c0c93a30>

Description:
Understanding Each Other: Know You, Know Me

 

A.R.I.S.E Asia Regional Team is pleased to invite you to join our first forum “Understanding Each Other: Know You, Know Me…” This forum seeks to broaden global awareness regarding the linguistic diversity of Asia (China, India, and Japan) and the variations in time zones across the continent.

 

We will navigate through the intricacies of the languages and the cultural tapestry; dispelling common misconceptions, addressing the facts, myths, and perceptions, and providing a deeper understanding of the cultural significance.

 

Together, let’s continue to foster inclusivity by learning about our colleagues and cultures, thereby understanding each other. Please watch this brief preview video <https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/cfa671e7-8d8b-4d27-b5d2-8002c0c93a30>  (no audio) to learn more.

 

 <https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/cfa671e7-8d8b-4d27-b5d2-8002c0c93a30> 

 

There are 2 sessions, please accept the one that is convenient for you.

Thursday July 13th – 9:00am – 10:00am ET

Friday July 14th – 9:00am – 10:00am CET

 

 

 <http://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/> 

A.R.I.S.E. invited you to a meeting.

Description:
Hi All,

          

We’ll utilize this timeslot to boost face-to-face connections with colleagues and LT. Do expect tons of fun games and activities, and you may have chance to win our surprise awards! 

 

Kindly note that this is an in-person-only ~15min event, and is not mandatory. But we would like to encourage employees to join the monthly meeting in office and take participate in this adjunctive activity, which is definitely a great opportunity to return to post-covid office, re-engage in our community, and re-connect with colleagues beyond projects. If you have any ideas or suggestions on how to advocate our in-person connection and collaboration, feel free to reach out to X-TA coordinators and Enliven team.

          

We hope everyone to relax, rejoice and have fun!

          

Best,

X-TA & Enliven team
Location: CR-GC-CNShanghai, Bldg CHJ-A, Rm 4F-7 Global Connect (18)

Subject: Discussion on Olivier's visits
Required Attendees: Zhang, Ting [JRDCN];Zhai, Jun (Tina) [JRDCN];Ma, Qing (Gina) [JRDCN];Pei, Yinghua [JRDCN];Chen, Yufan [JRDCN];Zhang, Qianyuan (Shirley) [JRDCN]
Description:
Dear all,

 

Olivier will visit Shanghai from Jul 31 to Aug 2.

I need your support to brainstorm ideas for the arrangements and our connections with him. Please accept my meeting if you have interest in supporting this activity.

Could you please think about it by yourself and we have a touch base next Monday? Any ideas are welcome! If you want to lead this effort, please also feel free to share with me. 

Really appreciate!

 

Thanks,

Ting

Optional Attendees: Liu, Xiaochang [JRDCN];Li, Qianqian [JRDCN];Yang, Casey [JRDCN];Liu, Xuelin [JRDCN];Cheng, Qianqian [JRDCN];Wang, Jie (Jerry) [JRDCN];Chen, Yufan [JRDCN];Song, Jiaqi [JRDCN];Yang, Shan [JRDCN];Zhang, Joy [JRDCN];Hou, Jieying [JRDCN];Hu, Peter Hao [JRDUS];Pei, Yinghua [JRDCN];Fan, David [JRDCN];Zhang, Qianyuan (Shirley) [JRDCN];Guo, Yi [JRDCN];Zhang, Ping [JRDCN];Chen, Kevin [JRDCN];Wei, Zhijie (Lyla) [JRDCN];Liu, He [JRDCN];Pan, Wenlan [JRDCN];Cui, Dan [JRDCN];Chen, Li [JRDCN];Li, Shechang [JRDCN];Tian, Zhikai [JRDCN];Zhang, Ting [JRDCN];Lyu, Lea You [JRDCN];Zhu, Qianqian (Debbie) [JRDCN];Yu, Bin [JRDCN];Peng, Mandy [JRDCN];Liu, Tina [JRDCN];Liang, Juan [JRDCN];Wu, Shuchun Coral [JRDCN];Zhang, Xiaofeng [JRDCN];Fu, Miao [JRDCN];Wang, Yuying [JRDCN];Sun, Yuping [JRDCN];Li, Jingru [JRDCN]
Description:
Dear All,

 

We are excited to announce this upcoming connect session, during which we’ll have face-to-face connection with Olivier, who will be paying a three-day visit to China. This session will provide a unique opportunity for us to share insights, exchange ideas and build connections with Olivier. We would encourage everyone to engage in person and enjoy this session😀

 

Please also expect a coming survey of attendance, also don’t hesitate to use this survey to share your thoughts or comments with us. Detailed agenda will be sent out later. 

 

Look forward to meeting with you at the connect session!

 

Best,

Gina, Qianyuan, Yinghua, Yufan and Jun

Description:
Dear all,

 

As you may know, we are preparing for the connection meeting with Olivier on July 31. 

As you have been recommended to share your stories, on behalf of Gina, Qianyuan, Yinghua, Yufan and Jun, I would like to invite you for further discussions about how to share your inspiring stories with other C&SP employees.

Really appreciate your efforts to grow yourself and others in advance! Let us discuss further tomorrow.

If I miss someone in the invitation, please feel free to forward. Thank you.

 

Thanks very much,

Ting

Description:
Dear Colleagues,

 

Please find the outline of 5 WD Delivery Workshop as the attachment, you can think about the related questions ahead of time and look forward to your discussion. 

Kindly note: Programming leads are required to join the workshop, it’s optional for supporting programmers based on your schedule. 

 

Look forward to your joining! 😊

 

Regards,

5 WD Delivery Team 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

 



 

After 5 WD delivery heads-up training in June C&SP monthly meeting, believe our colleagues has implemented / will implement this goal in our studies. 

To better enhance our 5 WD delivery process implementation, we are excited to debut episode “The 5 WD Delivery Workshop”. Here we would like to invite all of you to share your experiences and to trigger more discussion about 5 WD delivery. 

 

Workshop Info. :  Face-to-Face at Neighborhood Lounge(West) 3:00-5:00pm, 02Aug2023

 

Look forward to your joining! 😊

 

 

Regards,

5 WD Delivery Team

Description:
IDAR A.R.I.S.E. Book Club Meetings – Asia & Ally Group

The Weave of My Life, A Dalit Woman’s Memoir by Urmila Pawar

Theme: The weave of pain, suffering, and agony that links us. Activist and award-winning writer Urmila Pawar recounts three generations of Dalit women who struggled to overcome the burden of their caste. Dalits, or untouchables, make up India's poorest class. 

If you are interested in joining us to learn further, to discuss and reflect on this crucial content, please sign up by filling out this brief form <https://forms.office.com/r/EmD850wbN8> . 

There will be several meetings held in September and October. You may attend even if you have not signed up through the form, and you do not need to have read the whole book. Please accept whichever Outlook meeting invitation is convenient for you, all sessions will be the same.  Please read the attached email for more information on how to order the book.

SEPTEMBER SESSIONS:

US/EU 9am EDT/2pm BST/3pm CEST Tuesday 12SEP23 

EU/India/South Africa 11am BST, 3:30pm IST/12pm SAST Thursday  14SEP23 

Asia (China & Japan)/EU 4pm CST/5pm JST/ 9am BST Tuesday 12SEP23 

 

OCTOBER SESSIONS:

US/EU 9am EDT/2pm BST/3pm CEST Monday 16OCT23 

EU/India/South Africa 11am BST, 3:30pm IST/12pm SAST Tuesday 17OCT23 

Asia (China & Japan)/EU 4pm CST/5pm JST/ 9am BST Thursday 19OCT23 

 

Here is the link to the book <https://www.amazon.com/Weave-My-Life-Womans-Memoirs/dp/0231149018>  on Amazon US. See information here <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/IDAR_ARISE/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B016B9A90-8FB1-4D13-AA89-5906675CDD79%7D&file=Book%20Purchase%20Instructions.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true>  on how to expense the book. Description:
IDAR A.R.I.S.E. Book Club Meetings – Asia & Ally Group

The Weave of My Life, A Dalit Woman’s Memoir by Urmila Pawar

Theme: The weave of pain, suffering, and agony that links us. Activist and award-winning writer Urmila Pawar recounts three generations of Dalit women who struggled to overcome the burden of their caste. Dalits, or untouchables, make up India's poorest class. 

If you are interested in joining us to learn further, to discuss and reflect on this crucial content, please sign up by filling out this brief form <https://forms.office.com/r/EmD850wbN8> . 

There will be several meetings held in September and October. You may attend even if you have not signed up through the form, and you do not need to have read the whole book. Please accept whichever Outlook meeting invitation is convenient for you, all sessions will be the same.  Please read the attached email for more information on how to order the book.

Subject: Fireside Chat with Kate and Zili
Required Attendees: DL-JRDCN JCRD All;Owen, Kathryn   [JRDUS];Doherty, Eileen [JRDUS];Li, Mengjuan [JANJP];Chung, May [JACAP]
Description:
Dear colleagues, 

 

Kate Owen, Head of Global Development and Incoming Head of AP R&D will visit Beijing from August 2-4. For this trip, one of the most important objectives for Kate is to meet colleagues in JCRD. 

 

A fireside chat with Kate and Zili will be arranged and you are all invited to join. Joining this event will also be the entire JCRD leadership team and distinguished guests from AP and global R&D. 

 

During the chat, participants will have the opportunity to interact with our organizational leaders. In particular, Kate and Zili will share their outlook and expectation for the future. To ensure your voice is heard, please send the questions prior to the meeting via Form <https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=M0vJOjWRIUiVAur9plkqNRYei8LSHb1FvWycS7j4UNpURVNMNE5SV0s4TTREMllZTldQUzlTTThMQS4u> . 

 

Look forward to seeing you all there!

 

--------------------

Date: Wednesday, August 2, 2023

Time: 16:30-17:30

Location:

 

Beijing - Huamao Club, B1, Huamao Office Building

 

Shanghai (Caohejing) - Meeting Room 1+2, 1F, CHJ Office Building

Shanghai (Zhangjiang) - Meeting Room 502+551, ZJ Office Building

 

Join online: https://online.bizconfstreaming.com/webcast/janssen20230802.html

 

 



Please scan the QR code to access online
Location: Beijing: Huamao Club, B1, Huamao Office Building; Caohejing: Meeting Room 1+2, 1F, CHJ Office Building; Zhangjiang: Meeting Room 502+551, ZJ Office Building/ Online: https://online.bizconfstreaming.com/webcast/janssen20230802.html

Subject: A.R.I.S.E. Ally/Asian Book Club Meeting - US/EU  - October
Description:
IDAR A.R.I.S.E. Book Club Meetings – Asia & Ally Group

The Weave of My Life, A Dalit Woman’s Memoir by Urmila Pawar

Theme: The weave of pain, suffering, and agony that links us. Activist and award-winning writer Urmila Pawar recounts three generations of Dalit women who struggled to overcome the burden of their caste. Dalits, or untouchables, make up India's poorest class. 

If you are interested in joining us to learn further, to discuss and reflect on this crucial content, please sign up by filling out this brief form <https://forms.office.com/r/EmD850wbN8> . 

There will be several meetings held in September and October. You may attend even if you have not signed up through the form, and you do not need to have read the whole book. Please accept whichever Outlook meeting invitation is convenient for you, all sessions will be the same.  Please read the attached email for more information on how to order the book.

Subject: A.R.I.S.E. Indigenous/EU Book Club Meeting - EU/Asia session
Description:
IDAR A.R.I.S.E. Book Club Meetings – Indigenous & EU Group

Liberating Sapmi: Indigenous Resistance in Europe’s Far North - Gabriel Kuhn

Theme: Liberating Sápmi includes in-depth interviews with Sámi artists, activists, and scholars boldly standing up for the rights of their people. Gabriel Kuhn aims to raise awareness of the ongoing fight of the Sámi for justice and self-determination. The first accessible English-language introduction to the history of the Sámi people and the first account that focuses on their political resistance, this provocative work gives irrefutable evidence of the important role the Sámi play in the resistance of indigenous people against an economic and political system whose power to destroy all life on earth has reached a scale unprecedented in the history of humanity.

 

There will be two meetings held in October. You may attend even if you have not read the whole book. Please accept whichever Outlook meeting invitation is convenient for you; both sessions will be the same and include  Book Club Guidelines <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/:w:/t/IDAR_ARISE/EVY_TRLGxiNLnM0ggHQO6w4BFQXGCVWT18q7gv_qOBPmOA?e=gF7Idh> . 

 

BOOK CLUB SESSIONS:

EU / APAC Sámi Book Club Discussion:  18-October (Wednesday)  9:00 – 10:00 a.m. CET

 

Please order the book as soon as possible so you complete reading by October. Feel free to order in your native language if available. We encourage you to purchase the least expensive version of the book possible. Please investigate how to best purchase the book in your region, especially for those outside of the US. The link given may not be cost effective for you in your region. We encourage e-books for lower environmental impact.

This is the link to the book <https://www.amazon.com/Liberating-S%C3%A1pmi-Indigenous-Resistance-Europes/dp/1629637122>  on Amazon US. Subject: M&I Corner: Vulcan
Required Attendees: Wolf, Phyllis [JRDUS];Cramer, Amy   [JRDUS];DL-GD-IDAR-C&SP-JNJ;Desai, Jennifer [JRDUS];Van Aerden, Francois [JRDBE];Yuan, Olive [JRDBE]
Optional Attendees: DL-GD-JCI-JNJ;Langel, Kai [JACES];Brill, Stanley [JRDUS];Cochinaire, Alexandra [JRDGB];George, Joyce [JRDUS];Goebel, Laura [JRDUS];Liyanage, Nilani [ACTCH];Nijs, Marleen [JRDBE];Padhiar, Kirankumar  [JRDUS];Sandalic, Lali [ACTCH];Sotingco, Tatiana [JRDUS];Takacs, Susan [JRDUS];Decker, Craig [JRDUS];Rodriguez, Joaquin [JRDUS];Dwyer, Patrick [JANUS Non J&J];Patrick Dwyer;Richardson, Andrew [JRDGB NON-J&J]
Description:
Hi all –

Please join Amy Cramer, a Director/Focus Area Lead in Janssen Clinical Innovation (JCI) and the founder/co-chair of the HL7 FHIR Accelerator Vulcan, for a presentation and discussion on what Vulcan is.  

 

Spoiler alert – it’s an industry-wide effort to standardize the integration of healthcare data.  What does that mean for us in clinical research?  

 

Please feel free to pass this invite along to others in the organization.  The meeting will be recorded for those unable to attend. 

 

Hope to see you there!

Phyllis

Description:
Dear team,

 

The CSR first draft will be finished at the end of this week. In order to let everyone quickly understand the content, the vendor will give us a quick introduction to this first draft. Kindly book your time to discuss the content, and then welcome any revision comments about the first version by the end of 17th, Aug. All comments will be collected to the vendor. Please let me know if there is any time conflict.

 

Thanks for your time and looking forward to your comments.

 

Thanks and regards，

Xueyu

MA
